metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4087 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in iPXE. It has been declared as problematic. This vulnerability affects the function tls_new_ciphertext of the file src/net/tls.c of the component TLS. The manipulation of the argument pad_len leads to information exposure through discrepancy. The name of the patch is 186306d6199096b7a7c4b4574d4be8cdb8426729. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. VDB-214054 is the identifier assigned to this vulnerability.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> seems like it was introduced in commit 634a86093af9a6d134b that is not included in any release in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: ipxe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
